summary:
Brown University, located in Providence, Rhode Island, is one of the oldest and most prestigious universities in the United States. Founded in 1764, it was the first to welcome students of all religious backgrounds. Brown offers unique programs, like the oldest applied math and engineering courses in the country. It has a special curriculum without mandatory general education classes.

The university has produced many notable alumni, including Nobel Prize winners, Pulitzer Prize recipients, and even Olympic medalists. Brown's campus is known for its historic architecture, especially along Benefit Street. Getting into Brown is very competitive, with only 5% of applicants accepted recently.
title: Brown University
